verses.kjv: And I said, Hear, I pray you, O heads of Jacob, and ye princes of the house of Israel; Is it not for you to know judgment?
verses.web: I said, “Please listen, you heads of Jacob, and rulers of the house of Israel: Isn’t it for you to know justice?
verses.ct: Then I said, "Listen to me, you leaders of Jacob, you rulers of Israel! You of all people should know what justice looks like.

verses.kjv: Who hate the good, and love the evil; who pluck off their skin from off them, and their flesh from off their bones;
verses.web: You who hate the good, and love the evil; who tear off their skin, and their flesh from off their bones;
verses.ct: Instead, you hate what is good and love what is evil. You tear the skin off my people and strip the flesh from their bones.

verses.kjv: Who also eat the flesh of my people, and flay their skin from off them; and they break their bones, and chop them in pieces, as for the pot, and as flesh within the caldron.
verses.web: who also eat the flesh of my people, and peel their skin from off them, and break their bones, and chop them in pieces, as for the pot, and as meat within the cauldron.
verses.ct: You devour my people's flesh, rip the skin off their backs, and snap their bones apart. You chop them up like meat for a pot, like chunks of flesh thrown into a cauldron."

verses.kjv: Then shall they cry unto the LORD, but he will not hear them: he will even hide his face from them at that time, as they have behaved themselves ill in their doings.
verses.web: Then they will cry to LORD, but he will not answer them. Yes, he will hide his face from them at that time, because they made their deeds evil.”
verses.ct: When that day comes, they will cry out to the LORD, but he won't answer them. He will hide his face from them because of the evil things they have done.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD concerning the prophets that make my people err, that bite with their teeth, and cry, Peace; and he that putteth not into their mouths, they even prepare war against him.
verses.web: LORD says concerning the prophets who lead my people astray; for those who feed their teeth, they proclaim, “Peace!” and whoever doesn’t provide for their mouths, they prepare war against him:
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says about the prophets who lead my people astray: When someone feeds them, they announce, "Peace!" But when someone doesn't put food in their mouths, they declare war against him.

verses.kjv: Therefore night shall be unto you, that ye shall not have a vision; and it shall be dark unto you, that ye shall not divine; and the sun shall go down over the prophets, and the day shall be dark over them.
verses.web: “Therefore night is over you, with no vision, and it is dark to you, that you may not divine; and the sun will go down on the prophets, and the day will be black over them.
verses.ct: "Because of this, night will close in on you — you will receive no visions. Darkness will surround you — you will have no power to predict the future. The sun will set on these prophets, and their days will turn black.

verses.kjv: Then shall the seers be ashamed, and the diviners confounded: yea, they shall all cover their lips; for there is no answer of God.
verses.web: The seers shall be disappointed, and the diviners confounded. Yes, they shall all cover their lips; for there is no answer from God.”
verses.ct: The seers will be put to shame, and the diviners will be humiliated. They will all cover their mouths in silence, because there is no answer from God."

verses.kjv: But truly I am full of power by the spirit of the LORD, and of judgment, and of might, to declare unto Jacob his transgression, and to Israel his sin.
verses.web: But as for me, I am full of power by LORD’s Spirit, and of judgment, and of might, to declare to Jacob his disobedience, and to Israel his sin.
verses.ct: But as for me, I am filled with power by the spirit of the LORD, filled with justice and strength, to confront Jacob with his rebellion and Israel with his sin.

verses.kjv: Hear this, I pray you, ye heads of the house of Jacob, and princes of the house of Israel, that abhor judgment, and pervert all equity.
verses.web: Please listen to this, you heads of the house of Jacob, and rulers of the house of Israel, who abhor justice, and pervert all equity.
verses.ct: Listen to this, you leaders of Jacob, you rulers of Israel — you who despise justice and twist everything that is right.

verses.kjv: They build up Zion with blood, and Jerusalem with iniquity.
verses.web: They build up Zion with blood, and Jerusalem with iniquity.
verses.ct: You build up Zion with bloodshed and Jerusalem with wickedness.

verses.kjv: The heads thereof judge for reward, and the priests thereof teach for hire, and the prophets thereof divine for money: yet will they lean upon the LORD, and say, Is not the LORD among us? none evil can come upon us.
verses.web: Her leaders judge for bribes, and her priests teach for a price, and her prophets of it tell fortunes for money: yet they lean on LORD, and say, “Isn’t LORD among us? No disaster will come on us.”
verses.ct: Her leaders sell their verdicts for bribes. Her priests teach only when they're paid. Her prophets tell fortunes for money. Yet they lean on the LORD and say, "Isn't the LORD right here among us? No disaster will touch us."

verses.kjv: Therefore shall Zion for your sake be plowed as a field, and Jerusalem shall become heaps, and the mountain of the house as the high places of the forest.
verses.web: Therefore Zion for your sake will be plowed like a field, and Jerusalem will become heaps of rubble, and the mountain of the temple like the high places of a forest.
verses.ct: Because of you, Zion will be plowed up like an open field. Jerusalem will be reduced to piles of rubble, and the temple hill will become nothing but a wooded ridge.
